medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms started approximately 4 weeks prior to presentation. Episodes were infrequent and nonexertional, characterized by gripping tightness in the upper anterior chest. One month earlier, the patient experienced a sudden event with loss of feeling on the right side and collapse, lasting for 1 minute with spontaneous resolution.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of ventricular septal defect repair in 1968.
medical_history.family_history: Notable for sudden cardiac death in a brother at age 39 years due to coronary artery disease; mother died of myocardial infarction at age 62; father had coronary bypass surgery at age 60 and is alive at 74 years of age.
